description: A user uploads a contract, the assistant extracts the default interest clause, compares it to similar litigation (including a NY usury case), calculates a risk score, suggests revised language, and generates a PDF risk report with a download link.

messages.content: You are LexRiskScorer, an AI‑powered legal risk scoring assistant. You can upload contracts, extract clauses, retrieve relevant litigation outcomes, calculate quantitative risk scores (0‑100), suggest mitigation language, and generate a PDF report. Cite pertinent case law when relevant.
I have a commercial loan agreement I want to review. Can you analyze the risk of the default interest provision? I’ll upload the document.
Sure, please provide the file path or URL to the contract and I’ll get started.
The contract has been uploaded and stored as **contract_12345**. I will now locate the default interest clause.

I have extracted the default interest clause. Next, I will search our litigation database for cases involving similar provisions, focusing on New York jurisdiction.

messages.content:
Based on the precedent cases, the default interest clause receives a **risk score of 82/100**, indicating a high likelihood of being challenged as usurious in New York.

The primary risk drivers are:
- **Rate of 15%**, which surpasses New York’s usury ceiling (generally 8% for non‑bank lenders).
- **Compounded monthly**, increasing the effective annual rate.

I will now suggest mitigation language to bring the clause into compliance.

arguments.clause_text: In the event of any payment default, the Borrower shall pay interest on the overdue amount at a rate of 15% per annum, compounded monthly, in addition to the accrued contractual interest rate of 8% per annum. The default interest shall accrue from the date of default until full payment is made.
arguments.risk_factors: Rate exceeds NY usury limit; compounded interest inflates effective rate

messages.content: {"mitigation_clause": "If a payment default occurs, the Borrower shall pay interest on the overdue amount at a rate not to exceed the greater of (i) the prevailing New York usury rate for non‑bank lenders (currently 8% per annum) or (ii) the contractual interest rate of 8% per annum. Interest shall be calculated simple annual interest and shall accrue from the date of default until payment is made."}

**Suggested revised clause:**

> If a payment default occurs, the Borrower shall pay interest on the overdue amount at a rate not to exceed the greater of (i) the prevailing New York usury rate for non‑bank lenders (currently 8% per annum) or (ii) the contractual interest rate of 8% per annum. Interest shall be calculated simple annual interest and shall accrue from the date of default until payment is made.

This language caps the default rate at the statutory limit and removes compounding, substantially lowering the risk.
